message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
public class PersonIterator implements Iterator<Person> {
    private List<List<Person>> list;
    private int row;
    private int col;

    public PersonIterator(List<List<Person>> list) {
        this.list = list;
        this.row = 0;
        this.col = 0;
    }

    @Override
    public boolean hasNext() {
        return row < list.size() && col < list.get(row).size();
    }

    @Override
    public Person next() {
        Person person = list.get(row).get(col);
        col++;
        if (col >= list.get(row).size()) {
            col = 0;
            row++;
        }
        return person;
    }
}
 
<<<explanation>>>: In the PersonIterator class, we keep track of the current row and column indices. The hasNext() method checks if there are more elements in the 2D list by comparing the row and column indices with the size of the list. The next() method retrieves the current person at the given row and column indices, increments the column index, and if it reaches the end of the current row, resets the column index to 0 and increments the row index.
